**The Chapter of the Profound and Obscure**

The Dao speaks: These are the great Brahma’s esoteric incantations and boundless sounds of the various heavens, their ancient script extending a full *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign once transcribed their text to establish the correct intonation.

Li Shaowei’s annotation: *The Scripture of the True One’s Five Teeth* states: The Sovereign’s origins in attaining the Dao remain unknown. His body stood nine *chi* tall, covered in dark fur, each strand over a *chi* in length. During the Yellow Emperor’s reign, he dwelled beneath the Absolute Yin of Mount Emei, his abode wrought of azure jade, his seat of gold. Banners of patterned silk fluttered, and thousand-fold incense burned. His attendants—immortal youths and jade maidens—alongside three seated guests, all bore the title of Supreme Clarity’s Immortal Kings. The Yellow Emperor bowed twice to inquire of the Dao, whereupon the Sovereign bestowed upon him the scripture of the Five Teeth and Three Ones.

**The Chapter of the Profound Response**

Those who comprehend these sounds and recite them in purification rites shall have the flying heavenly divine kings of all heavens descend to observe their person, record their merits, and submit them to the heavens. The myriad spirits shall pay homage, earth deities stand guard at their gates, and the great demon kings shall safeguard and recommend them as immortals.

The Imperial Annotation states: One of great merit and virtue shall earn the trust of the Celestial Thearch and the demon kings, who will then recommend them before the Supreme Immortal Kings. With the Dao perfected, they may traverse the Three Realms and ascend through the Gate of Gold.

The Profound Master says: Those who know the sounds of the middle chapter and recite them in purification shall attain the blessings of the eighth rank. These sounds repel all, dispel all, deliver all, and accomplish all—utterances of the heavens’ spontaneous truth. Thus, reciting them summons flying immortals to descend in observation, the Celestial Thearch to chant from afar, the myriad spirits to pay homage, the Three Realms to attend their chariot, demonic hordes to bow their heads, ghostly essences to perish of their own accord, and jade-like tones to resonate. The *You* script declares: The ten directions grow solemn and pure, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists, the myriad spirits tremble in submission, and immortals gather in assembly. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth devoid of demonic dust, profound wisdom shines with limpid clarity, and the vastness of the profound remains profoundly profound. The *Hai* script states: The sounds of the middle chapter possess four boundless, majestic, and numinous powers—repelling, dispelling, delivering, and accomplishing. Those who recite them shall receive the sixteenfold auspicious responses.

The above constitutes the main text and postscript of the great Brahma’s esoteric incantations.

Cheng Xuanying’s annotation: This elucidates the power of the inner sounds of the heavens to penetrate and illuminate with obscure wisdom. *Obscure* denotes the unfathomably profound; *wisdom*, the boundlessly illuminating. Wisdom illuminates emptiness, hence the term *obscure wisdom*. *Vast* implies limitless height, while *limpid* signifies radiance above the Three Clarities. *Vast* is emptiness; *limpid* is purity. Without boundary or end, it is called *great vastness*. Within this great vastness dwells true emptiness; within true emptiness lies essence; within essence lies sincerity, which gives rise to true sages. Neither existent nor nonexistent, it abides in serene constancy, subtle beyond measure. To fathom its principle is impossible—profound within the profound, hence *the vastness of the profound remains profoundly profound*.

Bowing, I gaze toward the Jade Dawn, spiritual blossoms scatter golden rays.

The Supreme Ultimate Perfected says:
The Most High Jade Dawn Great Dao Lord dwells in the Purple Tenuity’s sevenfold-luminous heavens, transcribing mysterious scriptures. Jade consorts bear the sutras, golden lads scatter incense. The Great One holds the towel, jade pages attend the feast. Dragons chant, tigers roar, auspicious clouds shroud the mist. Ten directions’ Heavenly Perfected, exalted sages, Perfected of wondrous conduct, boundless flying celestial kings, the Three Realms’ great demons, the Nine Heavens’ countless elders—all chant the jade scriptures, take refuge in the Most High *Lingbao* wondrous Dharma, flourishing through eons, enduring eternally.

**The Fifth Scroll of the Primordial’s Boundless Salvation of Humanity’s Upper Scripture Concludes**

**Dharma Instructions:**
Upon completing the recitation, knock the teeth thirty-six times, bow in the heart to the ten directions, close the eyes, and silently intone the incantation:
*Your servant [Name] respectfully recites the golden script and jade sutra, ten cycles complete. I beseech the dragon chariot’s descent, heavenly spirits’ arrival, the dispatch of the Six Dings, seven ancestors’ ascent, and my own ascent to the Upper Clarity.*

Knock the teeth nine times, swallow saliva ten times, bow thrice in the heart, and silently chant:
*Supreme August Perfected, enable my spirit’s ascent.
Purify with fasting and refinement, recite the golden sutra.
Seven mysteries dispersed, ascend to the Great Void.
Prolong years and endure, inscribe names in the jade book.*

Knock the teeth nine times, recite the Highest Divine Empyrean Jade Clarity’s Demon-Quelling and Sin-Erasing Incantation:
*Fortune spreads before the Nine Mysteries, sins vanish amid the Three Paths.
Spirits push the Nine Celestial Peaks, qi enters the Great Emperor’s palace.
Five Immortals escort the Great One, together stationed in the Double Mystery’s void.
Thus concealed in the Upper Clarity’s chamber, luminously dwelling in the Emperor’s Unity’s abode.*

Knock the teeth three times, chant:
*True qi’s correct spirit, named Peach Lord.
Merging in the Palace of Life, guarding the Gate of Destiny.
Communing with immortals to summon qi, aligning with the treasure clouds of Jing.
Seven ancestors ascend together, receiving blessings in the lofty dawn.*

Knock the teeth three times, chant:
*Emperor Unity blends the nine qi, the Primordial’s jade essence.
Treasure feathers feast in the Jade Hall, eight winds fan the Great Radiance.
Ascending on jade light, traversing Brahma to tread long life.
Seven transformations descend to the Purple Chamber, nine blends purify the Five Emperors.
Bodies birth six-colored radiance, golden reflections flow through spirit forms.
All bathed within the primordial qi, golden script in the Jade Emperor’s court.*

Knock the teeth three times, chant:
*Most High Cavernous Clarity, flying scenes of the Nine Origins.
Congealing essence into darkness, transforming qi into spirit.
Life Directors merge, dispersing forms into myriad parts.
A thousand chariots of fire-armored, ten thousand riders raise banners.
Together with the Great One, ascending to become Imperial Immortals.
Eldest averts wrongdoing, Second accomplishes the curved script.
First merge my qi, second merge my spirit.
Third merge my hun, fourth merge my po.
Fifth merge my essence, sixth merge my body.
My body sixfold merged, cavernous spirits awaken truth.
Eight luminous void chariots, three pure floating wheels.
I and the Emperor Unity together ascend the Jade Celestial.*

Knock the teeth three times, chant:
*Layered blossoms, intertwined branches, merged with celestial immortals.
Body holds the Dao’s register, world possesses life’s root.
Golden tablets and jade talismans, names inscribed on the solar chariot.
Wishes instantly fulfilled, celestial records flourish.
Desires align with the heart, myriad spirits fill the gate.
Constantly abide with the Most High, the Emperor Unity in the mud-pill palace.*

Amidst the union of yin and yang, the hundred spirits entwine.
Recite the scriptures ten thousand times, cloud chariots come to receive.
Escorting the feast of the Five Emperors, the Nine Lords of Sun and Moon.
I attain immortality, ascending to the Jade Court.
Receive the office.

Clasp the Jade Purity mudra with both hands.
Knock the teeth nine times, chant:
*Your servant has completed the recitation of the scriptures. The Three and Five Functionaries of your servant’s body, the left and right official messengers, the golden lads attending incense, the jade maidens transmitting words, the direct talismans of the Five Emperors, and the incense officials of the appointed day—thirty-two each—now return to their golden chambers and jade halls. Let no errors arise; preserve my longevity. When summoned again, let them arrive as before, all according to precedent.*

Conclude the mudra, concentrate the mind, and restore the officials. Knock the teeth three times, offer incense, and with eyes closed, secretly chant:
*Those who have attended the scripture recitation, the sacred hosts who guarded the scriptures—now disperse the altar, dissolve the assembly, and return each to their posts. Let the divine winds fall silent, mountains and seas grow solemn and clear. A thousand evils hide in submission, a hundred spirits guard my form.*

Visualize the perfected saints of the ten directions, each ascending on clouds to the heavens, beginning from the east. For each direction, knock the teeth three times, bow thrice in the heart, then draw in the three-colored cloud qi with the nose, swallowing it into the five viscera. Envision the Four Numinous Beasts returning to their original positions. Knock the teeth three times, swallow saliva thrice, and conclude.

Return to the incense burner, chant:
*Follow the cyclical pattern from the *si* text to the *chen* text, passing through *yin* to *chou*, returning to the Jade Purity text. Clasp the mudra until reaching the incense burner, then release.*

*Immortal spirits, immortal officials, golden lads and messengers, the immortals and perfected of the Five Emperors and Five Marchmounts, the true deities of the Three Qi, the Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, celestial and terrestrial immortals, the incense officials of the Five Numinous Spirits—now summon the upright qi of the ten directions. May the golden elixir, cinnabar mushrooms, and azure herbs naturally arise. Let the hundred spirits and hosts of perfected gather at the grotto mystery and numinous treasure feast hall. Envision the five-colored auspicious radiance and auspicious qi intertwining with the perfected, thoroughly irrigating your servant’s body. Grant that your servant, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. Let my entire household receive blessings, and the world be enveloped in grace.*

For the deliverance of the deceased, chant:
*May the departed souls be delivered, the living receive grace. Let the jade lads and maidens of the ten directions attend the incense smoke. Envision the incense smoke ascending straight into the heavens, reporting: Your servant’s words just uttered swiftly reach the august presence of the Most High Primordial Sovereign of the Thirty-Two Heavens before the imperial seat.*

Release the mudra.
Next, perform the *Three Hearings of the Scripture*.

After the scripture has been heard, may all beings deeply enter the Dharma gate, take refuge, and receive it in faith.
After the scripture has been heard, may all beings have their myriad sins absolved and their virtuous sprouts grow.
After the scripture has been heard, may all beings forever sever delusion and constantly return to the true Dao.

Next, follow the intent of the scripture recitation with prayers of dedication.

In truth, the precious scriptures of the Three Caverns are the sacred models of the ten thousand heavens, weaving the flying mysteries into refined patterns, forming the cloud-seal chapters. Their meaning pervades the floating lives of mortals, and their texts endure through eternal kalpas. Thus, heaven and earth rely upon them for division and judgment; sun and moon depend on them for their movements. Ghosts and spirits revere them and thereby attain transformation; the people uphold them and thus bring forth prosperity. Therefore, those who recite them ascend in form to the crimson clouds, and those who hear them rise in spirit to the golden palaces. None fail to look up to them in the realms of humans and gods, or to rely on them in life and death. They serve as the bridge for all classes of beings and the door and window for all living things. Those who cannot hear them—how profound is their great vehicle’s mysterious treasury!

Earlier, your servant ascended the scripture seat and reverently recited *The Wondrous Scripture of the Primordial Limitless Salvation of All People, Upper Chapter* for a certain number of scrolls, completing the recitation in harmony. Today, on this occasion, I offer prayers to the sacred ranks, presenting the intentions of my supplications. In essence, I extend reverence to the highest perfected ones, seeking their luminous blessings. For the deliverance of the deceased, I declare: May the departed ascend and dwell in the immortal realms.

As for this scripture, when its case is opened and its mysteries expounded, its resonance pierces the Three Heavens; when its scroll is held and its verses chanted, its sound reaches the Nine Billion. May the golden lads attending the incense inscribe fragrant characters in the heavens, and may the jade youths in charge of the scriptures present its words upon the tablets. Thus, may transgressions from a hundred kalpas be dissolved, and blessings descend upon this day. May the living and the dead alike receive the grace of deliverance, and may all moving and growing things feel the gift of life’s completion. May all the countless kinds of beings, the dim and the stirring, together board the boat of the Six Perfections and ascend to the shores of the Three Clarities.

Specific intentions are separately recorded.

Proclaim the repentance, for the sake of excellent karmic conditions, and invoke:
The Most High Heavenly Worthy of the Three Clarities,
The Heavenly Worthy of Peace and National Protection,
The Heavenly Worthy of Limitless Blessings,
The Heavenly Worthy of Longevity and Life Preservation,
The Heavenly Worthy of Disaster Dispelling and Calamity Deliverance,
The Purple Clarity Heavenly Worthy of Bestowed Blessings,
The Heavenly Worthy of the Great One’s Salvation from Suffering,
The Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions’ Numinous Treasure,
The Heavenly Worthy of Complete and Perfect Flower Blessings,
And the immeasurable, inconceivable merits.

**Exiting the Chamber Spell:**
Exiting the yin, entering the yang, the myriad spirits open wide. The matters of the ritual are concluded—pray close the immortal chamber.

According to *The Oral Instructions on Visualization*:
The Azure Dragon on the left, the White Tiger on the right,
The Vermilion Bird in front, the Dark Warrior behind,
The Lion as the earthly beast beneath me—these ride with me.
The white cranes and flying birds above me—these cover me.
The spirits of the four directions, above and below, all arrive, known as the Six Ritual Arrangements.
Thus, they are arrayed to the left and right, front and back, above and below—this is clear.
Hence the phrase: "The Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane arrayed."

The left eye is the sun, the right eye is the moon.
The sun emerges from the left as the Great Yang of the left eye,
The moon emerges from the right as the Great Yin of the right eye.
This principle of the sun and moon on the left and right is also evident.
Hence the phrase: "The sun and moon on the left and right illuminate."

As for the Daoist teaching on these two chapters:
The great method states that the first chapter, from *The Primordial Cavern Mystery* to *The Arrayed Words of the Highest Clarity*, forms one chapter.
The second chapter, from *The Primordial Cavern Jade Calendar* to *The Obeisance to the Lofty Perfected*, forms another.
*The Purple Text of the Cinnabar Emperor of Tortoise Mountain* clearly annotates: "This is the demon-king’s song, proclaiming that I possess the true text of the Cavern Chapter."
Some mistakenly regard it as two chapters, leading to erroneous transmission and persistent errors, greatly distorting the scripture’s intent.
I dare not insist on correction but have consulted the great methods to verify this, appending it after "I possess the Cavern Chapter."
May those who recite it humbly seek understanding. The finger gestures and their instructions are listed below.
Each follows the finger joints in sequence.

**Three Clarities Mudra:**
Upper Clarity Text—upper joint of the middle finger.

**Jade Clarity Text**—middle joint of the middle finger, also called the *Celestial Sovereign Mudra*, termed the *Primordial Ancestral Qi*.

**Supreme Clarity Text**—base of the middle finger.

**Purple Tenuity Mudra**—pass the left hand’s little finger over the back of the fourth finger, hook it with the middle finger, and press the third joint of the fourth finger with the thumb, while the middle finger traces the horizontal line across the palm.

**Midnight-Noon Dipper Mudra**—the left thumb traces the *zi* line at the base of the fourth finger, then moves to the *chou* line at the base of the middle finger, shifts upward to the middle line of the middle finger, then to the middle line of the fourth finger, moves upward to the upper line of the fourth finger, then to the upper line of the middle finger, and straight up to the tip of the middle finger, where it flicks the *wu* line.

**Eight Trigrams Nine Palaces Diagram Mudra**
**Twelve Earthly Branches Mudra**
**Summoning Jade Emperor, Jade Lads, and Jade Maidens Mudra**
**Reciting the Central Scripture’s Wheel-Turning Secret Mudra**

Follow the nine-day *qi*-guiding cycle, beginning at *qián-hài*:
- **Guanyin**—*yín* line at the base of the second finger.
- **Pútán**—*chǒu* line at the base of the middle finger.
- **Liúyín**—middle line of the middle finger.

- **Dàqiān**—upper line of the middle finger.
- **Lǜzhān**—*wǔ* line at the tip of the middle finger.
- **Zìqiān**—*wèi* line at the tip of the fourth finger.
- **Fǎlún**—*shēn* line at the tip of the little finger.
- **Yùnróng**—*yǒu* line at the upper part of the little finger.
- **Zìgōng**—upper line of the fourth finger.
- **Jiǔtōng**—*shēn* line at the tip of the little finger.
- **Zhītáng**—*wèi* line at the tip of the fourth finger.

chunks.original_text: 太上洞玄灵宝无量度人上品经法 经名：太上洞玄灵宝无量度人上品经法。 南宋陈椿荣集注。 五卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞真部玉诀类。 谨按《灵宝经法》：凡九品阴功，及消禳灾害，并自用祈福，度厄行功，存身为元始天尊，坐空浮五色狮子之上，居日光中。 为天地父母、国王及天象，可以神诵。 上丹田神诵，四千遍。 为灾厄及他人，可以心诵。 中丹田心诵，三千遍。 为一切亡殁幽魂，可以炁诵。 下丹田炁诵。 三千遍。 每一存思，须得十遍。 十遍为一过，百遍为十过。 十言一叩齿，以召神； 百言一咽津，以和炁。 错一字，却前三十字以诵之； 越一字，再覆五十字以诵之。 诵则下声而诵之，咏则朗吟以咏声，使音句周竟，勿令匆速，苟贪遍数。 常令神魂悦畅，香炁绵绵，不绝於室。 若以音声华美，急逐遍数，亦无灵感，空尸诵经，欲飞返沈，非徒无益，亦招轻诵之愆。 玉几仙降笔 混沦未判，中存得一之灵； 大块既分，内抱生三之宝。 散而为炁，聚则成文，弥纶空洞之中，罗络虚玄之表。 元纲流演，立天地之精根； 万范开张，布阴阳之血脉。 五文普植，三景齐明，开天三十二重，结炁百千万道，于以保制劫运，辅赞皇图。 作回生起死之玄机，为入圣超凡之要妙。 演三洞，皆言有作； 教一国，尽达无为。 藏灵宝於身田，纳黍珠於性地。 举一念，入大浮黎土； 开重楼，登郁罗萧台。 常亲自己之虚皇，顿悟惟心之元始。 悠悠庶类，皆成不死真神； 蠢蠢群灵，咸曰长生大圣。 太上洞玄灵宝无量度人上品经法卷之一 太上三五都功职箓弟子陈椿荣集注 万圣尊崇，众真钦仰，无上可上，玄之又玄。 洞玄灵宝是品秩之名，无量度人即一卷之目。 诸经所宗，故曰上品； 功用微妙，是为妙经。 叙玄章 道言：　酉文。 上清玉晨大道君、灵宝天尊之言也。 道君序经，故以道言为首。 玄师日：凡有道言，皆玉晨大道君自序，非二章之首。 昔於始青天中， 始青天王隆腾胜天也。 碧落空歌　卯文　大浮黎土　离文， 浮黎，玉隆天帝内讳也。 受元始度人无量上品。 玉晨大道君为灵宝教主，乃元始天尊之弟子，太微天帝君之师也。 受灵宝上品度人之道。 启运章 元始天尊 注：元始天尊，是虚皇之应号也。 从真起应，则曰证修，妙思幽源，乃自性独有。 《洞神经》曰：妙象无形，应感有体，真精之炁，化成姿容。 当说是经，周回十过，以召十方。 元始天尊为道法宗主，当此劫运，开图出教，说法传经。 先周召十方天真，然后登座。 法曰：元始天尊，元自己元神，一身之主也。 真应章 始当诣座，　子至午文挑。 座者，空玄之座。 言方始当诣其座。 天真大神、　上清文。 上元至真，九品之真。 御注：是出三界、无修证、无位业之高真。 上圣高尊、　玉清文。 中元圣尊，九品之圣。 御注：是有修证、有位业之上圣。 妙行真人、　太清文。 下元仙真，九品真人。 御注：是元为元作之真人，皆在玉清之境，出离三界之天也。 此三号天真，比一身，则属上部八景神炁。 无鞅数众，乘空而来，飞云丹霄，绿舆琼轮，羽盖垂荫，流精玉光。 亥文。 流精玉光，是九色圆象。 又曰日月炁，天之灵宝也。 可以采炼，饵之成真。 五色郁勃　酉文，

**The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Upper Grade: Methods of the Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Upper Grade: Methods of the Scripture*
*Collected and Annotated by Chen Chunrong of the Southern Song*
*Five Scrolls*
*Source Text:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, *Jade Instructions* Category

According to *The Methods of the Numinous Treasure Scripture*: There are nine grades of hidden merit, for dispelling calamities and averting disasters, as well as for personal prayer and blessings, delivering from distress and performing merit. Visualize oneself as the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning, seated upon a five-colored lion in the void, dwelling within the radiance of the sun. For the parents of heaven and earth, the king, and celestial phenomena, recite with the voice. Recite in the upper cinnabar field four thousand times. For distress and others, recite with the mind. Recite in the middle cinnabar field three thousand times. For all departed and hidden souls, recite with qi. Recite in the lower cinnabar field three thousand times. Each visualization must be performed ten times. Ten recitations make one cycle; one hundred recitations make ten cycles. With every ten words, click the teeth to summon the spirits; with every hundred words, swallow saliva to harmonize qi. If a single character is mispronounced, recite the previous thirty characters again; if a character is skipped, recite the preceding fifty characters again. When reciting, do so in a low voice; when chanting, intone clearly, ensuring each phrase is complete. Do not rush or hasten for the sake of completing cycles. Always maintain a joyful spirit and soul, with fragrant qi flowing continuously, unbroken within the chamber. If one pursues ornate sounds and hastily completes cycles, there will be no numinous response—merely reciting the scripture with an empty corpse. This not only brings no benefit but also invites the transgression of frivolous recitation.

**The Immortal’s Brush Descends from the Jade Tablet**
Before the chaos divided, the spirit of unity dwelled within; after the great mass separated, the treasure of the three origins was embraced. Scattered, it becomes qi; gathered, it forms script. It pervades the empty and cavernous, weaving beyond the void and mysterious. The primordial net flows and unfolds, establishing the essence-root of heaven and earth; the myriad patterns expand, spreading the blood-vessels of yin and yang. The five scripts are universally planted, the three luminaries equally bright. It opens the thirty-two layers of heaven, condenses the hundred thousand myriad paths of qi, thereby preserving and regulating the kalpas, aiding and glorifying the imperial plan. It enacts the mysterious mechanism of reviving the dead and raising the deceased, serving as the essential wonder for entering sagehood and transcending the mundane. It expounds the Three Caverns, all speaking of action; it teaches a nation, all attaining non-action. Concealing the Numinous Treasure within the field of the body, receiving the millet-pearl in the ground of nature. With a single thought, enter the Great Floating Li Land; ascend the layered towers to mount the Terrace of Yu Luo Xiao. Constantly draw near to one’s own Void Sovereign, suddenly awakening to the Original Beginning within the mind. The boundless multitude of beings all become true immortals of deathlessness; the teeming host of spirits all proclaim the Great Sage of Eternal Life.

**The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Upper Grade: Methods of the Scripture, Scroll One**
*Collected and Annotated by Chen Chunrong, Disciple of the Register of the Three and Five Capital Merits*

The myriad sages are revered, all perfected beings look up in admiration—supreme beyond supremacy, mysterious beyond mystery. *Dongxuan Lingbao* is the name of its rank; *Limitless Salvation* is the title of this scroll. It is the origin of all scriptures, hence called the Upper Grade; its efficacy is subtle and wondrous, thus it is a wondrous scripture.

**Preface to the Mysterious Chapters**
The Dao speaks: *You* script.
These are the words of the Great Dao Lord of Jade Dawn of Supreme Clarity and the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy. The Dao Lord prefaces the scripture, thus beginning with "the Dao speaks."
The Mysterious Master says: All instances of "the Dao speaks" are the Great Dao Lord of Jade Dawn himself expounding, not merely the beginning of the second chapter.

Formerly, in the Azure Heaven of Beginnings—
The Azure Heaven of Beginnings is the King of Ascending Victory Heaven.
The Empty Song of the Blue Vault, *Mao* script; the Great Floating Li Land, *Li* script—
Floating Li is the inner taboo name of the Jade Ascension Heavenly Emperor.
—received the *Upper Grade Scripture of Limitless Salvation* from the Original Beginning.
The Great Dao Lord of Jade Dawn, as the master of the Numinous Treasure teachings, is the disciple of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning and the teacher of the Heavenly Emperor Lord of Grand Tenuity. He received the Upper Grade Dao of Limitless Salvation.

**Chapter on Initiating the Movement**
The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning
*Annotation:* The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning is the response-title of the Void Sovereign. From the true arises the response, thus it is called "attaining cultivation"; profound contemplation of the dark source is the unique possession of self-nature.
*The Scripture of the Cavernous Spirit* says: The wondrous image is formless; the response to stimuli has substance. The qi of true essence transforms into physical form.
When expounding this scripture, circumambulate ten times to summon the ten directions.
The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning, as the ancestral master of the Dao and its methods, at this kalpic movement, unfolds the chart and issues the teachings, preaching the scripture and transmitting the Dao. First, he circumambulates to summon the perfected of the ten directions, then ascends the throne.
The method says: The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning is the primordial spirit of one’s own original spirit, the master of the body.

**Chapter on the True Response**
At the beginning of approaching the throne—
*Zi* to *Wu* script, lifting.
The throne is the seat of the empty and mysterious. It speaks of just beginning to approach the seat.
The Great Spirits of Heavenly Perfection—
*Upper Clarity* script.
The perfected of the Upper Origin, the perfected of the nine grades.
*Imperial Annotation:* These are the high perfected who have transcended the Three Realms, without cultivation or attainment, without rank or karma.
The Lofty and Revered of the Upper Sages—
*Jade Clarity* script.
The sagely and revered of the Middle Origin, the sages of the nine grades.
*Imperial Annotation:* These are the upper sages who have cultivation and attainment, with rank and karma.
The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct—
*Supreme Clarity* script.
The immortals of the Lower Origin, the perfected of the nine grades.
*Imperial Annotation:* These are the perfected who are originally for original action, all residing in the realm of Jade Clarity, having transcended the heavens of the Three Realms.
This triad of titles of heavenly perfection, when compared to the body, pertains to the qi of the eight luminaries of the upper region.
An innumerable host arrives riding the void, soaring on vermilion clouds through the cinnabar dawn, in green chariots and jade wheels, with feathered canopies casting shade, streaming with jade radiance.
*Hai* script.
The streaming jade radiance is the nine-colored round image.
It is also called the qi of the sun and moon, the Numinous Treasure of heaven. It can be gathered and refined, ingested to become a perfected being.

chunks.original_text: 洞焕太空。 定极章　定观法。 大洞境界。 七日七夜，诸天日月星宿，璇玑玉衡，一时停轮。 玄师日：既言日月停轮，何以分其七日七夜之数？ 乃天尊妙用神通，化机运感之所致。 此之微妙圣应，天尊外化，日月不行，星宿不运，璇玑玉衡一时停轮，不显昼夜。 其实内运主宰功用，未尝暂停。 故玉晨明七日七夜之数，又非人世七日七夜之比。 以内言之，大定神光，湛然见玉清境，有七日七夜之功也。 日月停轮，二目不瞬也。 即非冥目，亦非内视，亦非临目，是七日七夜久视，停其目瞬，照明三部，内外洞然。 其一身炁血，朝运於百节经络，阴阳营卫，皆系於三部脉息。 其息，乃人之一身璇玑玉衡也。 四至为璇玑，三部为玉衡，既是璇玑不运，日月驻景，星宿停轮，四至不至，则三部不息，一身炁血俱不运转。 御注：兀然泰定，与神炁合也。 四星为璇玑，三星为玉衡。 璇玑玉衡之图 一呼一吸四至，共得六寸。 一呼二至、一吸二至，各得三寸。 一至得十五分，经纬天地，纵横十五，故上帝付黄帝河图也。 《灵宝内象丹旨》曰：人之一炁往来者，呼吸是也。 夫人一呼一吸，而为一息。 一息之间，则分阴阳，呼而明，为阳为昼； 吸而晦，为阴为夜。 七窍之呼，七日也； 七窍之吸，七夜也。 天机不动，神凝目住，脉定心停，故日七日七夜，日月星宿，漩玑玉衡，一时停轮也。 神风静默， 无吹嘘出入之息。
chunks.translated_text:
The void of Great Cavern shines resplendent.
*Chapter on Stabilizing the Ultimate* — *Method of Stabilized Contemplation*.
The realm of the Great Cavern.
For seven days and seven nights, the sun, moon, and stars of all heavens, the jade pivot and jade balance, all halt their turning.
The Mystic Master says: Since it speaks of the sun and moon halting their turning, how then are the seven days and seven nights distinguished? This arises from the wondrous efficacy and divine transformations of the Heavenly Worthy, the workings of responsive resonance in the mechanism of transformation. This subtle and marvelous sagely response is an external manifestation of the Heavenly Worthy: the sun and moon do not move, the stars do not revolve, the jade pivot and jade balance halt their turning all at once, and day and night are no longer apparent. Yet in truth, the inner workings of the governing power never cease for even a moment. Thus, the seven days and seven nights of Jade Dawn’s clarity are not to be compared with the seven days and seven nights of the human world. Speaking from within, the radiance of great stabilization, utterly serene, reveals the realm of Jade Clarity—this is the achievement of seven days and seven nights. The halting of the sun and moon’s turning is the unblinking of the two eyes. It is neither closed-eyed darkness, nor inner vision, nor gazing with open eyes, but rather the prolonged gaze of seven days and seven nights, ceasing all blinking, illuminating the three regions so that within and without are wholly radiant. The qi and blood of the entire body circulate through the hundred joints and meridians, the yin and yang constructive and defensive systems, all bound to the pulse and breath of the three regions. This breath is the jade pivot and jade balance of the human body. The four extremities constitute the jade pivot; the three regions, the jade balance. Since the jade pivot does not revolve, the sun and moon pause in their course, the stars halt their turning, the four extremities do not reach, and the three regions do not breathe—thus the qi and blood of the entire body cease their circulation.
*Imperial Annotation:* Utterly still in profound stabilization, merging with the spirit and qi.
The four stars form the jade pivot; the three stars, the jade balance.
*Diagram of the Jade Pivot and Jade Balance*
One inhalation and one exhalation reach the four extremities, totaling six inches. One inhalation reaches two extremities, one exhalation reaches two extremities, each measuring three inches. Each extremity spans fifteen divisions, weaving heaven and earth in fifteenfold warp and weft—thus did the Supreme Thearch bestow the *Yellow River Chart* upon the Yellow Thearch.
The *Esoteric Essentials of the Numinous Treasure Elixir* states: The coming and going of the single qi of the human being is none other than breath. Each inhalation and exhalation constitutes one breath. Within a single breath, yin and yang are distinguished: exhalation is bright, yang, and day; inhalation is dark, yin, and night. The exhalation of the seven apertures is the seven days; the inhalation of the seven apertures is the seven nights. When the celestial mechanism is unmoving, the spirit congeals and the gaze is fixed, the pulse stabilizes and the heart stills—thus for seven days and seven nights, the sun, moon, and stars, the jade pivot and jade balance, all halt their turning at once. The divine wind is hushed and silent, without the stirring of exhalation or inhalation.

chunks.original_text: 山海藏云， 子文。 无蔽明妄想之业。 天无浮翳， 清明湛寂也。 四黑朗清。 卯文。 自然温凉寒燠也。 一国地土， 犹一身也。 山川林木， 犹四肢百脉，毛发孔窍，营卫骨节也。 缅平一等，无复高下。 土皆作碧玉，无有异色。 入於道定之境，湛然体性，一身内外，皆如碧玉，无一毫之尘也。 玄师曰：定观七日，不知昼夜，观心无心，乃是真元之心； 观形无形，乃识本始真形。 心形都无，自入无形之道，此乃大定，神光湛然，见玉清境，有七日七夜之功也。 众真侍座。 玉清文。 天尊以大法而感召，十方天真则随感而咸集，亦犹收神气海，藏息丹田，则三万六千神官，自侍左右。 还元章 元始天尊玄坐空浮五色狮子之上，　午文。 玄师曰：天尊空浮，乃自己元神居玉清宫。 玄坐者，法身所御也。 狮子者，元始威神也。 是五炁朝绛宫，威神之妙化结成狮子，天尊乘之下入丹田，左青、右白、前赤、后黑、中黄，故有五色狮子之象，因成五行。 说经一遍，诸天大圣同时称善。 是时一国男女聋病，耳皆开聪。 天一生水也，乃坎之炁孕於乾金。 诸天大圣同时称善者，万神一时俱畅。 一国男女者，法身阴阳二炁。 聋病者，坎为耳，故属之。 玄师曰：至道言之，迷音，不知音外真病耳。 不听 无声，大聪亦聋。 御注：何谓之聋？ 以耳无听德之善故也。 一闻天尊说法，则天耳开聪，法音流响，洞然无碍也。 余同此说。 说经二遍，盲者目明。 地二生火也。 乃离之炁孕於巽木。 离为目，目应心，心昧於物，暗而若盲。 依道而行，心开意悟，物莫能蔽邪。 说经三遍，喑者能言。 天三生木也。 乃震之炁孕於艮水。 艮为山，山高土厚，水泉出焉。 说经四遍，跛痾积逮，皆能起行。 地四生金也。 乃兑之炁孕於坤土。 起行者，乃植立之状，木性有焉。 说经五遍，久病痼疾，一时复形。 天五生土也，乃离寄戊而土炁孕於离也。 说经六遍，发白返黑，齿落更生。 天一生水，以地六成之。 说经七遍，老者返壮，少者皆强。 地二生火，以天七成之。 说经八遍，妇人怀妊，鸟兽含胎，已生未生，皆得生成。 天三生木，以地八成之。 归东处震为砂，乃艮震合，而木成於水。 砂者，汞感铅炁而结。 说经九遍，地藏发泄，金玉露形。 地四生金，以天九成之。 还西兑方为金，乃坤兑合，而金成於土，盖汞归土釜而成宝也。 说经十遍，枯骨更生，皆起成人。 是时，一国是男是女，莫不倾心，皆受护度，咸得长生。 天五生土，以地十成之。 玄师日：天尊十遍说经，五行生成之道，先五行生数，后五行成数，十转回灵之道也。 明其道则长生，用其道则证此十瑞大功。 重玄章 道言：是时元始天尊 覆述天尊周回说经，以召十方之事。 重显指其方所次序。 说经一遍　震文，　东方 无极无量品至真大、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 太安堂乡纳善世界。 说经二遍　离文，　南方 无极无量品至真大、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 宛梨城境弃贤世界。 一云宛梨。 一作宛利。 说经三遍　兑文，　西方无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 福堂洲咸行世界。 说经四遍　坎文，　北方无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 郁单野清净世界。 说经五遍　艮文，　东北无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。
chunks.translated_text:
Mountains and seas conceal the clouds—*Zi* script.
Without obstruction, deluded thoughts and karmic deeds dissolve.
The heavens, free of drifting veils, are limpid, luminous, and profoundly still.
The Four Blacks yield to clarity—*Mao* script.
Naturally, warmth, coolness, cold, and heat arise.

A kingdom’s land is like a single body.
Its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees are as the four limbs and hundred vessels,
its hair, pores, and orifices as the *ying* and *wei*,
its bones and joints as the framework.
All is level and uniform, without high or low.
The earth is transformed into green jade, without variation in hue.

Entering the realm of Daoist samādhi,
the profound essence of the body is serene.
Within and without, the entire form becomes like green jade,
without a speck of dust.

The Mystic Master says:
In seven days of meditative contemplation, one loses awareness of day and night.
Observing the heart as no-heart, one knows the heart of true origin.
Observing form as no-form, one recognizes the original true form.
When both heart and form vanish, one naturally enters the formless Dao.
This is the great samādhi.
The divine radiance is profoundly still,
and the Jade Clarity realm is revealed—
the fruit of seven days and seven nights’ practice.

The Host of Perfected Ones attends in audience—*Jade Clarity* script.
When the Heavenly Worthy invokes the Great Dharma,
the Perfected Ones of the ten directions respond and assemble,
just as when the spirit and qi are gathered into the Sea of Qi,
and breath is stored in the Cinnabar Field,
the thirty-six thousand spirit-officials attend at one’s left and right.

**Chapter of Returning to the Origin**
The Primordial Heavenly Worthy sits in profound stillness atop a floating five-colored lion—*Wu* script.
The Mystic Master says:
The Heavenly Worthy’s floating stillness is one’s own original spirit abiding in the Jade Clarity Palace.
The profound sitting is the Dharma-body’s dominion.
The lion is the majestic power of the Primordial Beginning.
When the five qi pay homage to the Crimson Palace,
the wondrous transformation of majestic power coalesces into a lion.
The Heavenly Worthy rides it down into the Cinnabar Field—
left blue, right white, front red, rear black, center yellow—
thus forming the five-colored lion, the image of the Five Agents.
After expounding the scripture once, the Heavenly Hosts and Great Sages all praise its excellence.

At that time, the deaf and ailing of the entire kingdom regain their hearing.
Heaven engenders Water—
the qi of *Kan* is conceived within the Metal of *Qian*.
When the Heavenly Hosts and Great Sages all praise its excellence,
the myriad spirits rejoice as one.
The men and women of the kingdom are the yin and yang qi of the Dharma-body.
The deaf and ailing correspond to *Kan*, which governs the ears.
The Mystic Master says:
In the discourse of the Supreme Dao,
ignorance of sound is not knowing the true malady beyond sound.
Not listening to the soundless, the profoundly wise are also deaf.
The *Imperial Commentary* asks: What is deafness?
It is the ear’s lack of the virtue of hearing.
Upon hearing the Heavenly Worthy expound the Dharma,
the heavenly ear opens, and the Dharma-sound flows unimpeded, perfectly clear.
The rest follows this principle.

After expounding the scripture a second time, the blind regain their sight.
Earth engenders Fire—
the qi of *Li* is conceived within the Wood of *Xun*.
*Li* governs the eyes, which correspond to the heart.
When the heart is deluded by phenomena, it darkens like blindness.
Following the Dao in practice, the heart opens and the mind awakens—
nothing can obscure or mislead.

After expounding the scripture a third time, the mute can speak.
Heaven engenders Wood—
the qi of *Zhen* is conceived within the Water of *Gen*.
*Gen* is the mountain, where earth is thick and high, and springs emerge.

After expounding the scripture a fourth time, the lame and those afflicted with chronic ailments all rise and walk.
Earth engenders Metal—
the qi of *Dui* is conceived within the Earth of *Kun*.
To rise and walk is the nature of standing upright, akin to Wood.

After expounding the scripture a fifth time, those suffering from long-standing illnesses all recover their forms.
Heaven engenders Earth—
the qi of Earth, lodged in *Wu*, is conceived within *Li*.

After expounding the scripture a sixth time, white hair returns to black, and fallen teeth regrow.
Heaven engenders Water, completed by the sixth of Earth.

After expounding the scripture a seventh time, the old return to youth, and the young grow strong.
Earth engenders Fire, completed by the seventh of Heaven.

After expounding the scripture an eighth time, pregnant women, birds, and beasts—
whether their offspring are born or unborn—
all attain full development.
Heaven engenders Wood, completed by the eighth of Earth.
Returning to the East, *Zhen* becomes cinnabar—
*Gen* and *Zhen* unite, and Wood is perfected in Water.
Cinnabar is mercury responding to the qi of lead and congealing.

After expounding the scripture a ninth time, the earth’s hidden treasures are revealed, and gold and jade appear.
Earth engenders Metal, completed by the ninth of Heaven.
Returning to the West, *Dui* becomes Metal—
*Kun* and *Dui* unite, and Metal is perfected in Earth,
for mercury returns to the earthen crucible to become treasure.

After expounding the scripture a tenth time, withered bones revive and rise as living people.
At that time, every man and woman in the kingdom turns their heart in devotion,
all receive protection and deliverance, and together attain longevity.
Heaven engenders Earth, completed by the tenth of Earth.

The Mystic Master says:
When the Heavenly Worthy expounds the scripture ten times,
it is the Dao of the Five Agents’ generation and completion—
first the generating numbers of the Five Agents, then their completing numbers,
the ten revolutions of the returning spirit.
To illuminate this Dao is to attain longevity;
to apply it is to realize these ten wondrous accomplishments.

**Chapter of the Profound Mystery**
The Dao speaks:
At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy recapitulated the Heavenly Worthy’s circuit of scripture-expounding,
invoking the affairs of the ten directions.
The sequence of directions is reaffirmed.

After expounding the scripture once—*Zhen* script—
the East:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Tai’an Tang* village, the *Nashan* world.

After expounding the scripture twice—*Li* script—
the South:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Wanli* city precinct, the *Qixian* world.
(One version reads *Wanli*; another, *Wanli*.)

After expounding the scripture thrice—*Dui* script—
the West:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Futang* isle, the *Xianxing* world.

After expounding the scripture four times—*Kan* script—
the North:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Yudan* wilderness, the *Qingjing* world.

After expounding the scripture five times—*Gen* script—
the Northeast:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.

chunks.original_text: 福集乡长安世界。 说经六遍　巽文，　东南无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 元福田用贤世界。 说经七遍　坤文，　西南无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 延福乡仁静世界。 说经八遍　乾文，　西北无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 福德野延贤世界。 说经九遍，　戌下亥上，　上方无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 诸天宫阙。 说经十遍，　辰上巳下，　下方无极 无量品至真大神、无鞅之众，浮空而至。 洞渊九垒，正行游梵四音，三十六宫，大地官府，北酆诸宫。 十遍周竟，十方无极天真大神，一时同至。 一国男女，倾心归仰，来者有如细雨密雾，无鞅之众，迮国一半，土皆偏陷，非可禁止。 於是元始悬一宝珠，　双手拾玉清文。 大如黍米，在空玄之中，去地五丈。 玄师曰：天尊施玄妙大化，悬一宝珠在空玄之中，莫测所悬之系。 黍米者，馨香五谷之长。 去地五丈者，离於五欲、五尘、五聚、五色、五香、五声，出五浊世，在五行数外，故能入空玄之妙。 薛幽栖注：宝珠者，喻道也，亦同玄珠之义。 黍米者，五谷之长，为生人之本，言人之得经如命之资米。 五浊既出，自无众息； 五行不用，永离相刻。

The *Fuji* village, the *Chang’an* world.
After expounding the scripture six times—*Xun* script—
the Southeast:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Yuanfutian Yongxian* world.

After expounding the scripture seven times—*Kun* script—
the Southwest:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Yanfu* village, the *Renjing* world.

After expounding the scripture eight times—*Qian* script—
the Northwest:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the *Fude* wilderness, the *Yanxian* world.

After expounding the scripture nine times—*Xu* below, *Hai* above—
the Above:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the palaces and towers of all the heavens.

After expounding the scripture ten times—*Chen* above, *Si* below—
the Below:
the boundless, immeasurable hosts of the supremely true and great spirits,
the innumerable assembly, arrive floating through the void.
From the ninefold abysses of *Dongyuan*, the four tones of the wandering Brahma,
the thirty-six palaces, the earthly bureaus, the northern *Feng* courts.

When the ten recitations are complete, the supremely true and great spirits of the ten boundless directions arrive all at once. The men and women of the land turn their hearts in reverence, coming like fine rain or dense mist—an innumerable throng, filling half the kingdom, causing the earth to tilt and sink, beyond all restraint.

Then the Primordial Beginning suspends a single treasure pearl,
both hands lifting the *Yuqing* script.
It is as small as a grain of millet, hanging in the midst of the dark mystery,
five *zhang* above the earth.
The Dark Master says: The Heavenly Worthy enacts the wondrous, great transformation, suspending a treasure pearl in the dark mystery—none can fathom its tether.
The millet grain is the chief of the five fragrant grains.
Five *zhang* above the earth means departing the five desires, the five dusts, the five aggregates, the five colors, the five scents, the five sounds, emerging from the five turbid worlds, beyond the reckoning of the five phases—thus able to enter the wondrous mystery of the dark void.

Xue Youqi’s note: The treasure pearl is a metaphor for the Dao, akin to the meaning of the Dark Pearl. The millet grain, chief of the five grains, is the root of human life, signifying that one’s attainment of the scripture is as vital as rice to life. Once the five turbidities are transcended, all afflictions naturally cease; when the five phases are no longer employed, one forever escapes mutual harm.

chunks.original_text: 自然长生久视，得道成真。 元始登引天真大神、上圣高尊、妙行真人、十方无极至真大神、无鞅数众，俱入宝珠之中。 天人仰看，唯见勃勃从珠口中入，既入珠口，不知所在。 天真上圣、妙行至真，炁合道妙，体合道真，故能随天尊登引入空玄黍珠之中。 天人体未合真，不能同入，仰看而已。 且下格小仙，有芥子纳须弥之妙，悬壶天地之境，何况大圣天尊，敷宣大教，示现神变也。 以至道言之，一国者，一身之比。 倾陷者，道有倾迮，未全一体，难称玄重之妙。 天人则万神也。 天真大神、上圣高尊、妙行真人，则三元之神也。 天尊则自己元神、一身之主也。 以内景妙道言之，乃玉清宝珠神仙胎化之诀。 国人廓散，地还平正，无复欹陷。 元始即於宝珠之内，说经都竟，众真监度以授於我。 元始说经於宝珠之中，众圣俱入。 此时只度道君一人，道君受得此经，故云以授於我。 我即道君自称也。 当此之时，喜庆难言。 法事粗悉，诸天复位。 倏欻之间，寂无遗响。 是时天人遇值经法，普得济度，全其本年，无有中伤。 倾土归仰，咸行善心。 不杀不害， 除身业罪。 不嫉不妬， 除心业罪。 不淫不盗， 除身业罪。 不贪不欲， 除心业罪。 不憎不。 言 无华绮，口无恶声。 复除心业罪也。 此十二大戒，凡修诵此经，先须受持。 齐同慈爱，异骨成亲，国安民丰，欣乐太平。 演梵章 经始出教，一国以道，预有至心，宗奉礼敬，皆得度世。 双手玉清文至此放。 宣秘章 道言：元始天尊说经中所言，并是诸天上帝。 内名隐韵之音，亦是魔王内讳，百灵之隐名也，非世之常辞。 上圣章 上圣已成，
chunks.translated_text:
Spontaneously attaining long life and enduring vision, one achieves the Dao and becomes a perfected being. The Primordial Beginning ascended and guided the Celestial Perfected Divinities, the Supreme Sages of Lofty Eminence, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Boundless and Utmost Perfected Divinities of the Ten Directions, and the innumerable hosts—all entering into the treasure pearl. Heavenly beings gazed upward, seeing only a surging movement as they entered through the pearl’s mouth; once within, their whereabouts were unknown. The Celestial Perfected and Supreme Sages, their *qi* harmonized with the wondrous Dao, their bodies united with the true Dao, were thus able to follow the Heavenly Worthy’s ascent into the dark void’s millet pearl. Heavenly beings, their bodies not yet united with the true, could not enter together but could only gaze upward.

Moreover, lesser immortals of lower rank possess the wondrous ability to contain Mount Sumeru within a mustard seed and suspend heaven and earth within a gourd—how much more so the Great Sage Heavenly Worthy, who unfolds and proclaims the great teaching, manifesting divine transformations! From the perspective of the utmost Dao, a kingdom is but an analogy for the body. Collapse and ruin signify that the Dao has faltered and narrowed, its unity incomplete, and thus it cannot be called the wondrous profundity of the dark mystery. Heavenly beings are the myriad spirits; the Celestial Perfected Divinities, Supreme Sages of Lofty Eminence, and Perfected of Wondrous Conduct are the spirits of the Three Primes; the Heavenly Worthy is one’s own primordial spirit, the master of the body.

From the perspective of the wondrous inner landscape of the Dao, this is the secret of the Jade Clarity treasure pearl’s immortal embryo transformation. The people of the kingdom disperse and scatter, the land returns to levelness, and no further tilting or sinking remains. Within the treasure pearl, the Primordial Beginning completed the recitation of the scripture in full, and the assembled perfected beings supervised its transmission to me. The Primordial Beginning expounded the scripture within the treasure pearl, and all the sages entered therein. At that time, only the Dao Lord was ordained; the Dao Lord received this scripture, and thus it is said to have been transmitted to me. “I” is the Dao Lord’s self-reference.

At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words. The Dharma rites were roughly complete, and the various heavens returned to their positions. In the blink of an eye, all was silent, with no lingering echoes. At that time, the heavenly beings who encountered the scripture’s Dharma were universally delivered and saved, preserving their original years without harm or injury. The people of the fallen land returned to reverence, all cultivating kind hearts. They did not kill or harm, eliminating the sins of bodily karma; they did not envy or covet, eliminating the sins of mental karma; they did not lust or steal, eliminating the sins of bodily karma; they did not greed or desire, eliminating the sins of mental karma; they did not hate or resent, and their speech was free of embellishment and deceit, their mouths free of evil words—further eliminating the sins of mental karma.

These twelve great precepts must first be received and upheld by all who study and recite this scripture. With unified compassion and love, even those of different bones become kin; the kingdom is at peace, the people prosperous, and all delight in great tranquility.

The *Yanfan Chapter*:
When the scripture first emerged to teach the realm, all within the kingdom who possessed utmost sincerity, revered and honored it, and were delivered across the world.

The *Shuangshou Yuqing Wen* concludes here.

The *Xuanmi Chapter*:
The Dao states: All that the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy expounded within the scripture are the inner names and hidden rhymes of the Celestial Emperors of the various heavens. They are also the inner taboos of demon kings and the secret names of the hundred spirits—no ordinary words of the world.

The *Shangsheng Chapter*:
The Supreme Sages have already attained perfection...

chunks.original_text: 上圣洞合道妙，功德已成。 真人通玄究微，能悉其章，誧之十过。 十遍为一过，百遍为十过，诵经当以十过为法。 诸天遥唱，万帝设礼，河海静默，山岳藏云。 无出入息也。 日月停景， 目不瞬也。 璇玑不行， 脉不息也。 此亦大定之法。 群魔束形，鬼精灭爽。 上清文。 玄师曰：酆都六洞内外一十二宫魔王乃魔灵，又曰群魔。 此魔坏人善性，附人恶事，干试学人，世有禽畜，五行精物，化为鬼魔。 此辈分形异类，神同於人。 又有外道妖魔及精灵苦爽之鬼，化天尊神仙真人，惑乱善人道士，明详勿失，坠入此流中。 回尸起死，白骨成人。 玄师曰：真人能通玄究微，晓达经内大洞秘讳，获十品感应功德，此真人之格也。 至学章 至学之士，
chunks.translated_text:
The Supreme Sages merge profoundly with the wondrous Dao, their virtue and power perfected. The Perfected Ones fathom the mysterious and probe the subtle, mastering its chapters and reciting them tenfold in transgressions. Ten recitations make one transgression, a hundred recitations make ten transgressions—reciting the scripture should follow the method of ten transgressions. The myriad heavens chant from afar, the ten thousand emperors perform rites, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks conceal their clouds. There is no inhalation or exhalation. The sun and moon halt their radiance, the eyes do not blink. The celestial pivot ceases to turn, the pulse does not rest—this is also the method of great samādhi. The host of demons bind their forms, ghostly spirits lose their clarity.

*Upper Clarity Text*
The Mystic Master states: The demon kings of the six caverns within and without the Fengdu Twelve Palaces are demonic spirits, also called the host of demons. These demons corrupt human goodness, cling to human evil, and test those who cultivate the Dao. In the world, there are birds and beasts, the essence of the Five Phases, which transform into ghostly demons. These beings take on different forms and kinds, yet their spirits are the same as humans. There are also heretical demons, bewitching spirits, and the suffering souls of ghosts who transform into Heavenly Worthies, divine immortals, and Perfected Ones to delude and confuse good people and Daoists. Be clear and discerning, lest you fall among this current. They turn corpses back to life and raise the dead, making white bones become human.

The Mystic Master states: The Perfected Ones who fathom the mysterious and probe the subtle, who comprehend the great cavernous secret taboos within the scripture, attain the merit of ten grades of spiritual response—this is the standard of the Perfected Ones.

chunks.original_text: 心坚於金石，操烈於水火，天地不能逾，鬼神不能惑，行人之所不能行，以有若无，此太极以下有仙名者。 诵之十过，则五帝侍卫，三界稽首，魔精丧眼，鬼妖灭爽。 上清文。 济度垂死，绝而得生。 玄师曰：至人学士诵之，获六品功德。 所以尔者，学士秽炁未消，体未洞真，召制十方玉清文，威未制天政。 天政，谓日月五星、天文七政。 德可伏御地祇，束缚魔灵，　玉清文。 但却死而已，不能更生。 学士骨体未真，秽炁仍在，不能威制天象，止获三品功德，此至士之格也。 劝道章 轻诵此章，身则被殃。 不斋戒沐浴、行香诵者，获被殃之罪。 供养尊礼，门户兴隆，世世昌炽，与善因缘，万灾不干，神明护门。 玉清文。 供养尊礼，获五品善果。 赞玄章 斯经尊妙，独步玉京，度人无量，为万道之宗，巍巍大范，德难可胜。 修诵章 道言：凡诵是经十过， 凡诵者则不限高下之格，是能依法精心诵持十过者。 诸天齐到，亿曾万祖，幽魂苦爽，皆即受度，上升朱宫，格皆九年。 三元品戒，朱陵度人之格，有五等。 九年者，中福之格。 大福则三年，小福则二十四年。 受化更生，得为贵人。 而好学至经，功满德就，皆得神仙，飞升金阙，游宴玉京也。 玄师日：师受有经之者，不以修持，止诵经十过，致此玄应。 此言自身功德果报，度万祖苦爽上升朱官，依朱陵品格，九年受化，更生得为贵人。 若夙灵通达，不昧其本，而能好学至经，自身功德满日，飞升上清之天，游宴大罗玉京也。 此凡诵十过之格也。 上学章 上学之士，
chunks.translated_text:
With hearts firmer than metal and stone, conduct more resolute than water and fire—such that neither Heaven nor Earth can surpass, nor ghosts and spirits delude—walking paths others cannot tread, treating existence as nonexistence: these are those below the Great Ultimate who bear the name of immortals. Recite this ten times, and the Five Emperors stand guard, the Three Realms bow in reverence, demonic essences lose their sight, and ghostly specters perish in spirit.

*Upper Clarity Text.* It delivers the dying and revives the perished.

The Mystic Master states: When Perfected Ones and scholars recite this, they attain the merit of the sixth grade. The reason lies in this: scholars’ impure qi has not yet dissipated, their bodies have not fully realized the True, and though they summon and command the Jade Clarity Texts of the ten directions, their power does not yet govern the celestial administration. The celestial administration refers to the sun, moon, five planets, and the seven celestial regulators. Their virtue may subdue earthly deities and bind demonic spirits—*Jade Clarity Text*—yet they can only avert death, not restore life. Scholars’ bones and bodies remain unrefined, impure qi still lingers, and they cannot command celestial phenomena, thus attaining only the merit of the third grade. This is the standard of the Perfected Scholar.

*Exhortation to the Dao Chapter*
To recite this chapter lightly brings calamity upon oneself. Those who recite without fasting, bathing, or burning incense incur the sin of misfortune. Those who honor it with reverence and offerings will see their households flourish, their generations prosper, and their good karmic connections endure. Ten thousand disasters will not touch them, and divine spirits will guard their gates.

*Jade Clarity Text.* Those who honor it with reverence and offerings attain the fivefold good fruit.

*Eulogy of the Mysterious Chapter*
This scripture is most venerable, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It delivers countless beings and stands as the root of all Daoist teachings. Its majestic model is vast, its virtue beyond measure.

*Recitation Chapter*
The Dao states: For all who recite this scripture ten times—regardless of rank or station—those who recite it with wholehearted devotion according to the proper method will see all heavens assemble. Countless generations of ancestors, suffering souls in darkness, will all be delivered, ascending to the Crimson Palace, where they undergo transformation over nine years.

The Three Primes’ Precepts and the Crimson Mound’s standards for deliverance comprise five grades. Nine years marks the middle fortune; great fortune is three years, and lesser fortune is twenty-four. After transformation and rebirth, they become noble persons. If they then devote themselves to the study of the supreme scriptures, their merit complete and virtue perfected, they all attain divine immortality, soaring to the Golden Gates and roaming the Jade Capital.

The Mystic Master says: Even those who receive the scripture without cultivation—merely reciting it ten times—bring forth this mysterious response. This refers to the karmic reward of one’s own merit, delivering ten thousand generations of suffering ancestors to ascend to the Crimson Palace. According to the Crimson Mound’s standards, they undergo nine years of transformation, are reborn as noble persons, and if their innate wisdom is clear and unobscured, they may devote themselves to the study of the supreme scriptures. When their own merit and virtue are fulfilled, they ascend to the heavens of Upper Clarity, roaming and feasting in the Great Veil’s Jade Capital. This is the standard for all who recite it ten times.

chunks.original_text: 闻道动行，见法秘学，始终不替，寒暑无亏，此太清九宫已下有仙名者。 修诵是经， 内修其道，外诵是经。 皆即受度，飞升南宫。 玄师曰：上学之士，亦修亦诵，不能度於万祖，止得自身受度，此上士之格也。 世人受诵， 世人者，常途之人也，非出群之士。 则延寿长年，后皆得作尸解之道。 魂神暂灭，不经地狱，即得返形，游行太空。 诣师受经诵之，止得延寿尸解，此世人之格也。 从真至此，凡有五等，则阶级差殊也。 畅微章 此经微妙，普度无穷，一切天人，莫不受庆，无量之福，生死蒙惠。 效盟章 上天所宝，不传下世，至士赍金宝，效心盟天而传。 轻泄漏慢，殃及九祖，长役鬼官。 前以轻诵殃身，后以轻泄殃及九祖。 玄师曰：若轻泄易忽，漏慢玄科，妄泄非人，不依年限而私传，或依年限而不斋，或盟受漏秘禁，使轻慢不信玄文，皆入中科。 殃及九祖，长役鬼官者，地府主役鬼之官也。 五岳扫山，酆都役隶，山河迭治，此鬼官役也。 又有驱雷役电，天官役也，担沙负石，地官役也，涟汲溟波，水官役也，此三官徒役也。 玄局章 侍经五帝，玉童玉女二十四人， 红杏、震文。 墨黑、坎文。
chunks.translated_text:
Those who hear the Dao and act upon it, who behold the Dharma and guard its esoteric studies, never wavering from beginning to end, unwavering through cold and heat—these are those whose names are recorded as immortals below the Nine Palaces of Great Clarity. Those who cultivate and recite this scripture, inwardly refining the Dao and outwardly reciting the text, are all immediately delivered and ascend to the Southern Palace.

The Mystic Master says: Those of advanced study both cultivate and recite, yet cannot deliver ten thousand generations of ancestors, only securing their own deliverance—this is the standard for superior adepts.

As for those of the world who recite it—these are ordinary people, not those who stand apart from the multitude. They extend their years and lengthen their lifespan, and afterward all attain the Dao of liberation through the corpse. Their ethereal souls temporarily dissolve, bypassing the hells, and immediately regain their forms, roaming the great void. Those who receive and recite the scripture from a master merely extend their lifespan and achieve liberation through the corpse—this is the standard for worldly people.

From the perfected to these, there are five ranks, each with its distinct gradations.

*The Unfolding Mysteries Chapter*
This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. All heavenly and mortal beings receive its blessings, and immeasurable fortune bestows grace upon the living and the dead.

*The Pledge of Devotion Chapter*
What heaven treasures is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted offer gold and treasures, pledging their hearts to heaven in transmission. Those who lightly disclose or neglect it bring calamity upon nine generations, consigning them to long servitude under the ghostly officials.

Previously, careless recitation brought misfortune upon oneself; now, careless disclosure brings misfortune upon nine generations.

The Mystic Master says: Those who lightly disclose, treat it with negligence, or violate the esoteric statutes—recklessly transmitting to the unworthy, failing to observe the prescribed years, or transmitting without purification, or pledging to receive it while leaking its secrets—causing others to treat the mysterious text with disdain and disbelief—all fall into the middle category. The calamity extends to nine generations, consigning them to long servitude under the ghostly officials, who oversee the labor of spirits in the earthly prisons.

They are made to sweep the Five Peaks, serve as laborers in Fengdu, alternately tend mountains and rivers—this is the labor of the ghostly officials. Some are driven to command thunder and lightning—this is the labor of the heavenly officials. Others bear sand and carry stones—this is the labor of the earthly officials. Still others draw water from the vast waves—this is the labor of the watery officials. These are the penal servitudes of the three bureaus.

*The Mystic Bureau Chapter*
Those who attend this scripture are served by the Five Emperors, twenty-four Jade Lads and Jade Maidens—Red Apricot and the Thunder Script, Ink-Black and the Kan Script.

chunks.original_text: 磨真、兑文。 袜腊、离文。 灵宝。 中文掐定，取五方炁吹。 营卫神文，保护受经者身。 中文剔诀。 东方九炁青灵启道童子、青灵玉女，南方三炁丹灵启道童子、丹灵玉女，西方七炁皓灵启道童子、皓灵玉女，北方五炁玄灵启道童子、玄灵玉女，中央一炁黄灵启道童子、黄灵玉女，各二十四人。 此五方五老帝君各遣玉童玉女，计二百四十人，侍卫保护。 玄师日：此乃五行四季、九官二十四炁之神，皆在身中。 三元章 道言：正月长斋， 斋者，谓身无杂务，心不外驰，内外清虚，抱元守一，终乎此月，故曰长斋。 诵咏是经， 诵则下声而诵之，咏则朗吟以咏声。 为上世亡魂，断地逮役，度上南宫。 玄师曰：正月者，上元天官会地、水二官於上元紫微宫，校诸功德，名举迁赏会之月，宜度上世祖考亡魂，断诸三徒之役。 七月长斋，诵咏是经，身得神仙，诸天书名，黄箓白简，削死上生。 七月者，中元地官会天、水二官於中元阳台宫，校勘功过，名庆生中会之月，宜度己身，诸天书名，而得神仙也。 黄箓者，天之金箓也。 白简者，死籍也。 所谓金箓上生名，白简削死字也。 十月长斋，诵咏是经，为国王帝主、君臣父子安镇国祚，保天长存，世世不绝，常为人君安镇其方，民称太平。 十月者，下元水官会天地二官、诸天诸地诸水真圣仙灵、星宿宫曹鬼神主宰，普校一切功过善恶，於东极天之尾闾，泄水之源清泠府中。 名普校建生大会之月，宜为国祝安、帝王圣祚，及依法安镇有灾之方，则民称太平矣。 又法曰：正月属寅，寅为鬼道，是以拔济先亡。 按《存思口诀》：水始生，火长生寅，水火既济，炼度死魂，玉眸炼质，黄华荡形。 七月属申，申为人门，是以自度己身。 按《存思口诀》：火之成数，水土长生申。 此乃成数，所以得度。 十月属亥，亥为天门，是以上为帝王安镇国祚，下为臣庶保护太平。 按《存思口诀》：土之成数，木之长生亥，木乃祖炁，所以为父子也。 土之成数，所以为帝王国主也。 八节之日，诵咏是经，得为九宫真人。 一坎文，二坤文，三震文，四巽文，五中文，六乾文，七兑文； 八艮文，九离文，复掐中文。 八节者，四立、二至、二分日也。 八方天真朝集，校量罪福功过於上元八景宫中。 至日斋戒本方，消禳九州地分，四十五日，水火、兵旱、灾疠； 诵咏向其方，顺宫以建指。 冬至坎用事，立春艮用事，春分震用事，立夏巽用事，夏至离用事，立秋坤用事，秋分兑用事，立冬乾用事。 周回八宫，以应八节，惟中宫者，已也。 身在中宫，得守於五也。 故为九宫真人也。 正是戴九履一，左三右七，二四为肩，六八为足，五为吾腹，乃上清九元豁落之道也。 八节九宫图 本命之日，诵咏是经，魂神澄正　玉清文，万炁长存。 不经苦恼，身有光明。 三界侍卫，五帝司迎。 万神朝礼，名书上天。 功满德就，飞升上清。 玉清文至上清文挑。 本命之日，百神朝身，诸天所重。 此日修诵，拘魂制魄，保命宁神，澄正五脏，万炁集身。 行道章 此章当默念内思，依法修存。 道言行道之日， 诵经之日也。 皆当香汤沐浴， 五香之汤也。 白芷、青木香、白檀香、沈香、甘松，取东流水煎汤。 存思口诀，香沐上，汤浴下。

**Grinding the True, Dui Script.**
**Wax-Linen, Li Script.**
**Numinous Treasure.**
With the Central Script, press and seal, draw the qi of the Five Directions and blow it forth. These are the divine talismanic texts of defense, guarding the body of the scripture’s recipient. The Central Script is then released.

From the East, nine qi: the Azure Numinous Dao Lads and Azure Numinous Jade Maidens.
From the South, three qi: the Cinnabar Numinous Dao Lads and Cinnabar Numinous Jade Maidens.
From the West, seven qi: the Radiant Numinous Dao Lads and Radiant Numinous Jade Maidens.
From the North, five qi: the Mysterious Numinous Dao Lads and Mysterious Numinous Jade Maidens.
From the Center, one qi: the Yellow Numinous Dao Lads and Yellow Numinous Jade Maidens.
Each direction sends twenty-four Jade Lads and Jade Maidens—two hundred forty in total—dispatched by the Five Elder Thearchs of the Five Directions to serve, guard, and protect.

The Mystic Master says: These are the spirits of the Five Phases, four seasons, Nine Palaces, and twenty-four qi, all dwelling within the body.

**The Three Primordials Chapter**
The Dao declares: In the first month, observe the long fast.
Fasting means the body is free of杂务, the mind does not stray outward, inner and outer are pure and empty, embracing the Origin and guarding the One throughout the month—hence it is called the long fast.
Recite and chant this scripture—
*Recitation* is done in a low voice, *chanting* is intoned with clear melody—
to sever the earthly penal servitude of the departed souls of former generations and deliver them to the Upper Southern Palace.

The Mystic Master says: The first month is the month when the Celestial Official of the Upper Primordial convenes with the Earthly and Watery Officials at the Upper Primordial Purple Tenuity Palace to review merits and virtues, a month of promotion and reward. It is fitting to deliver the departed souls of ancestors, severing their servitude in the Three Bureaus.

In the seventh month, observe the long fast, recite and chant this scripture, and the body attains immortality. The names are inscribed in the heavens on yellow registers and white tablets, erasing death and ascending to life.
The seventh month is when the Earthly Official of the Middle Primordial convenes with the Celestial and Watery Officials at the Middle Primordial Yang Terrace Palace to assess merits and transgressions, a month of celebrating life. It is fitting to deliver oneself, inscribing one’s name in the heavens to attain immortality.
The *yellow register* is the celestial golden register. The *white tablet* is the register of the dead. Thus, the golden register records the name of the living, while the white tablet erases the name of the dead.

In the tenth month, observe the long fast, recite and chant this scripture, to secure the throne for kings and emperors, rulers and ministers, fathers and sons, stabilizing the nation’s destiny, preserving the heavens’ eternal endurance, ensuring the ruler’s perpetual reign over the land and the people’s acclaim of great peace.
The tenth month is when the Watery Official of the Lower Primordial convenes with the Celestial and Earthly Officials, all the Perfected Sages and Immortals of the heavens, earth, and waters, the stellar lodges, palace bureaus, and ghostly administrators, to universally review all merits, transgressions, good, and evil at the Tailu of the Eastern Ultimate Heaven, the source of the draining waters in the Clear Cold Mansion. It is the month of the Great Assembly for Universal Review and Life’s Establishment. It is fitting to pray for the nation’s stability, the emperor’s sagely reign, and to pacify afflicted regions according to the rites, so the people may acclaim great peace.

Another method states: The first month belongs to *yin*, the ghostly path, hence it is for delivering the departed.
According to the *Oral Instructions for Visualization*: Water begins to generate, fire’s long-life phase is *yin*. With water and fire in harmonious balance, the dead souls are refined and delivered, their jade pupils tempered, their yellow essence purified of form.

The seventh month belongs to *shen*, the gate of humanity, hence it is for delivering oneself.
According to the *Oral Instructions for Visualization*: Fire’s completion number, water and earth’s long-life phase is *shen*. This is the completion number, thus one attains deliverance.

The tenth month belongs to *hai*, the gate of heaven, hence it is for securing the nation’s destiny for emperors above and preserving great peace for ministers and commoners below.
According to the *Oral Instructions for Visualization*: Earth’s completion number, wood’s long-life phase is *hai*. Wood is the ancestral qi, thus it pertains to fathers and sons. Earth’s completion number pertains to emperors and rulers of nations.

On the days of the eight nodes, recite and chant this scripture to become a Perfected of the Nine Palaces.
First, the Kan Script; second, the Kun Script; third, the Zhen Script; fourth, the Xun Script; fifth, the Central Script; sixth, the Qian Script; seventh, the Dui Script; eighth, the Gen Script; ninth, the Li Script—then press and seal the Central Script again.
The eight nodes are the days of the four *li* (seasonal beginnings), two *zhi* (solstices), and two *fen* (equinoxes). The Perfected of the Eight Directions gather to assess sins, blessings, merits, and transgressions at the Upper Primordial Eightfold Radiance Palace.
On these days, fast and abstain in the corresponding direction to dispel and exorcise the forty-five days of water and fire disasters, warfare, drought, and pestilence across the nine regions of the earth. Recite and chant toward that direction, aligning the palace with the established pointer.
Winter solstice: Kan governs. Spring *li*: Gen governs. Spring equinox: Zhen governs. Summer *li*: Xun governs. Summer solstice: Li governs. Autumn *li*: Kun governs. Autumn equinox: Dui governs. Winter *li*: Qian governs.
The eight palaces cycle in correspondence with the eight nodes, with the Central Palace being the self. Dwelling in the Central Palace, one guards the Five—thus becoming a Perfected of the Nine Palaces.
This is precisely the *Nine and One* of the Upper Clarity’s Ninefold Primordial Huoluo Dao: wearing nine above, treading one below, three on the left, seven on the right, two and four as shoulders, six and eight as feet, five as one’s belly.

**Diagram of the Eight Nodes and Nine Palaces**
On one’s natal day, recite and chant this scripture: the hun-soul and spirit become pure and upright.
The *Jade Clarity Script*—the myriad qi endure forever.
Free from suffering and affliction, the body radiates light.
The Three Realms serve as guards, the Five Thearchs oversee the reception.
The myriad spirits pay homage, the name is inscribed in the heavens.
With merits fulfilled and virtue perfected, one ascends to fly in the Upper Clarity.
From the *Jade Clarity Script* to the *Upper Clarity Script*, the seal is released.

On one’s natal day, the hundred spirits attend the body, revered by all heavens. On this day, cultivate and recite to restrain the hun-soul and po-soul, preserve life and pacify the spirit, purify the five viscera, and gather the myriad qi into the body.

**The Practice Chapter**
This chapter is to be silently recited and inwardly visualized, cultivated according to the method.
The Dao declares: On the day of practicing the Dao—
the day of reciting the scripture—
one must bathe in fragrant water:
the five-fragrance decoction—*baizhi*, *qingmuxiang*, white sandalwood, *chenxiang*, and *gansong*—brewed with east-flowing water.
The *Oral Instructions for Visualization*: incense above, fragrant bath below.

*The Mystic Bureau Chapter*

chunks.original_text: 谓焚香沐上，以手拂香入鼻，想入顶门泥丸； 次饮水浴下，若大沐浴，日沐月浴，即运日从左目出左太阳，上有赤光，下注成火，合我心火烧身毕。 次存光芒复日太阳上左停，次运月从右目出右太阴，上有玉光，下注成雨，合我肾水，如大海中洗浴我身，涤去五脏秽浊。 存玉光复月太阴上右停，日月洞照我身，如在虚空云座， 无有隔碍，定念斋心。 斋戒， 斋者，内斋其心，外斋其形。 戒者，内持其志，外持其行。 玄师曰：斋者有四，一曰心斋，二曰常斋，三曰清净斋，四曰长斋。 戒者，十二大戒，在经。 无上十戒，九真妙戒。 详载大法。 入室东向， 东为长生之方，诸天所尊，入室诵经，迎而向之。 存思。 诀，一谓召十方元鞅之神，入於己身，曰入室。 背死向生，曰东向。 一谓入静室而东向。 两说并用，内外相应也。 叩齿三十二通，上闻三十二天， 叩齿以集神。 叩齿之法，左为天钟，伐鬼灵也。 右为天磬，集百灵也，中为天鼓，朝圣真也。 叩齿，击天鼓也。 想其声如鼓，上震顶门，响彻三十二天。 心拜三十二过， 心拜，不倾侧泥丸九宫也。 心拜过於形拜，形虽不动，存心屈伏，如身礼也。 闭目存三十二天，自北维起太皇黄曾天，由东入南至西，每方各有八天，在青霄五色云内、金楼玉殿，各见一帝君，俨然分明。 次存自身左耳脑缝出东八天，额前出南八天，右耳脑缝出西八天，脑后出北八天。 却自皇曾天为始，每念一天名，叩齿一通，心拜一拜。 次第二玉完天，周回四方，至贾奕天，总三十二拜。 按大法，皇曾天治在北方亥之西，乘西北方奎、壁二宿梵炁。 东向诵经，东八天出於左耳脑缝者，此皇曾天起自北维也。 三十二天位次之图 凡诵念，当依此图，存习精熟，知天所在，举念运心，了然分明，免致临时疑回不决。 闭目静思。 存神定志，入於玄微妙化之境。

It is said: burn incense above and bathe in fragrance, then with the hand brush the incense into the nose, visualizing it entering the *niwan* at the crown of the head. Next, drink water below to bathe, as in the great bathing—solar bathing and lunar bathing—then circulate the sun to emerge from the left eye and the left *Taiyang*, above which is a crimson light that descends to form fire, merging with the fire of my heart to burn the body completely. Then visualize the radiance returning to rest above the sun’s *Taiyang*. Next, circulate the moon to emerge from the right eye and the right *Taiyin*, above which is a jade light that descends to form rain, merging with the water of my kidneys, washing my body in the great sea to cleanse the five viscera of filth and turbidity. Visualize the jade light returning to rest above the moon’s *Taiyin*. Sun and moon illuminate my body through and through, as if seated in the void amid clouds, without obstruction. Stabilize the mind and purify the heart.

Purification and precepts: purification means inwardly purifying the heart and outwardly purifying the form. Precepts mean inwardly holding fast to resolve and outwardly holding fast to conduct. The Mystic Master says: purification has four kinds—first, heart purification; second, constant purification; third, pure and undefiled purification; fourth, perpetual purification. As for precepts, the twelve great precepts are found in the scriptures, the unsurpassed ten precepts, and the nine numinous wondrous precepts, all detailed in the great methods.

Enter the chamber facing east: east is the direction of long life, revered by all heavens. When entering the chamber to recite scriptures, face east in welcome. Visualization: the oral instructions say one meaning is to summon the primordial spirits of the ten directions into one’s body, called "entering the chamber." Turning from death toward life is called "facing east." Another meaning is to enter a quiet chamber and face east. Both interpretations are used together, so inner and outer correspond.

Knock the teeth thirty-two times to reach the thirty-two heavens: knocking the teeth gathers the spirits. The method of knocking the teeth: the left is the *Heavenly Bell*, subduing demonic spirits; the right is the *Heavenly Chime*, gathering the hundred spirits; the center is the *Heavenly Drum*, attending the sagely perfected. Knocking the teeth is striking the Heavenly Drum. Visualize the sound like a drum, ascending to shake the crown of the head, resounding through the thirty-two heavens.

Bow in the heart thirty-two times: heart-bowing means not inclining the *niwan*’s nine palaces. Heart-bowing surpasses physical bowing; though the body does not move, the heart is humbled as if prostrating.

With eyes closed, visualize the thirty-two heavens, beginning at the northern quadrant with the *Great August Yellow Canopy Heaven*, then moving east to south and west, each direction having eight heavens within the azure clouds and five-colored mists, golden towers and jade halls, each with an emperor-lord, solemn and distinct. Next, visualize from the left ear’s cranial seam the eastern eight heavens, from the forehead the southern eight heavens, from the right ear’s cranial seam the western eight heavens, and from the back of the head the northern eight heavens. Then, beginning again with the *Yellow Canopy Heaven*, for each heaven’s name, knock the teeth once and bow in the heart once. Proceed through the second, the *Jade Perfection Heaven*, circling the four directions to the *Jia Yi Heaven*, totaling thirty-two bows.

According to the great methods, the *Yellow Canopy Heaven* governs the northwest of the northern quadrant, riding the *qi* of the *Kui* and *Bi* constellations in the northwest. Facing east to recite scriptures, the eastern eight heavens emerge from the left ear’s cranial seam because the *Yellow Canopy Heaven* begins at the northern quadrant.

**Diagram of the Thirty-Two Heavens’ Positions**
For all recitation, rely on this diagram, practicing visualization until thoroughly familiar, knowing the heavens’ locations. When raising the mind and directing intention, all is clear and distinct, avoiding hesitation or doubt at the moment.

Close the eyes and still the mind, visualizing the spirits and stabilizing resolve to enter the wondrously subtle and marvelously transformed realm.

chunks.original_text: 闭目者，收视也。 收视则神还内观； 静思者，心不外驰，专思其神也。 身坐青、黄、白三色云炁之中，内外蓊冥。 以舌抵上腭，先闭炁十二息。 存三元正宫中有三炁，内彻五脏之间。 存下元丹田宫白炁，升中元绛宫黄炁，混合为一。 存中元黄、白炁上升上元泥丸宫青炁，混合为一。 三炁从顶门出，外盈一室，交络身形，缠映所坐，自然蓊冥也。 玄师日：玄炁青、元炁黄、始界白，即是三炁也。 皆从一炁而生。 今居三炁之中，以学人存三守一之道。 一者，炁之母也，真常之道也。 《存思口诀》：青、黄、白三色之炁，乃太上始生之炁，玄元始三炁也。 天地始生，三炁凝结，所以诵经之士，身坐三炁之中。 青乃东方之炁也，故在兆之前； 黄乃中央之炁也，故在兆所坐处。 白乃西方之炁也，故在兆之后。 何不说红、黑二炁？ 乃水火也。 天地未生，已具此炁，天地始生，未形此炁，四象既有，二炁始明，为日月也。 蓊冥者，为已处黄炁之中，二炁在外掩映，自然苍冥也。 有青龙、 存肝中青炁从眼出，嘘化为青龙，侍于左。 目是肝候。 白虎、 肺中白炁从鼻出，咽化为白虎，侍于右。 鼻为肺应。 朱雀、 心中赤炁从口出，呵化为朱雀，导于前。 舌是心宫。 玄武、 肾中黑炁从耳出，吹化为玄武，立于后。 耳为肾司，左出龟，右出蛇。 狮子、 脾下出五色狮子，呼在坐下。 一法胆出狮子六只。 一云十二只，列于左右。 白鹤， 白鹤自胃从顶出嘻九只在上。 罗列 罗列于左右、前后、上下。

Closing the eyes is the gathering of vision. When vision is gathered, the spirit returns to inward contemplation. Stillness of thought means the mind does not stray outward, focusing solely on the spirit.

The body sits amidst the *qi* of the three colors—azure, yellow, and white—enveloping both within and without in misty obscurity. Press the tongue to the upper palate and first close the *qi* for twelve breaths. Visualize the three *qi* within the Three Primordial Palaces, penetrating the five viscera. Envision the white *qi* of the Lower Primordial Elixir Field Palace ascending to merge with the yellow *qi* of the Middle Primordial Crimson Palace, blending as one. Then visualize the yellow and white *qi* of the Middle Primordial ascending to unite with the azure *qi* of the Upper Primordial Mud Pill Palace, merging as one. The three *qi* emerge from the crown of the head, filling the chamber, interweaving with the body’s form, suffusing the seat in natural obscurity.

The Mystic Master said: The Mystic *qi* is azure, the Primordial *qi* is yellow, and the Initial Boundary is white—these are the three *qi*, all born from the One *qi*. Now abiding within the three *qi*, one practices the adept’s way of preserving the Three while guarding the One. The One is the mother of *qi*, the Way of true constancy.

**Oral Instructions for Visualization:**
The *qi* of the three colors—azure, yellow, and white—are the primordial *qi* of the Most High, the Three *qi* of the Mystic, Primordial, and Initial. When heaven and earth first arose, the three *qi* congealed and coalesced. Thus, the practitioner of scripture recitation sits amidst the three *qi*. Azure is the *qi* of the east, hence it lies before the adept; yellow is the *qi* of the center, hence it resides where the adept sits; white is the *qi* of the west, hence it lies behind the adept. Why not speak of the red and black *qi*? They are water and fire. Before heaven and earth were born, these *qi* already existed; when heaven and earth first arose, these *qi* had yet to take form. Once the Four Symbols emerged, the two *qi* became manifest as the sun and moon.

The misty obscurity arises from being enveloped within the yellow *qi*, while the two *qi* beyond veil and reflect it, naturally creating a deep, shadowy hue.

**Azure Dragon:**
Visualize the azure *qi* within the liver emerging from the eyes, transformed through exhalation into an Azure Dragon, attending on the left. The eyes are the liver’s emissaries.

**White Tiger:**
Visualize the white *qi* within the lungs emerging from the nose, transformed through swallowing into a White Tiger, attending on the right. The nose is the lungs’ correspondence.

**Vermilion Bird:**
Visualize the red *qi* within the heart emerging from the mouth, transformed through exhaling into a Vermilion Bird, leading ahead. The tongue is the heart’s palace.

**Dark Warrior:**
Visualize the black *qi* within the kidneys emerging from the ears, transformed through blowing into a Dark Warrior, standing behind. The ears govern the kidneys; the left emits a tortoise, the right a serpent.

**Lion:**
From below the spleen, five-colored lions emerge through exhalation, seated beneath. One method has the gallbladder emitting six lions; another states twelve lions arrayed to left and right.

**White Cranes:**

chunks.original_text: 诀曰：四方上下之神备至，名曰六仪。 左右， 法曰：左日右月出眉后两太阳、六一合之府。 日月照明， 存日自左太阳出于左目，日紫赤炁九芒。 存月自右太阴出于右目，月黄白炁十芒。 此自己日月也。 洞焕室内，项生圆象，光映十方， 存日月各去面九寸，辉耀室内，光芒灌入鼻口，入脑后玉枕宫，发九色圆象，出项后，如虹霓之状，光彻十方。 如此分明。 存前三炁四灵，狮子白鹤，日月圆象，一一分明。 一法日在前，月在后； 东向诵经，大明生於东，月生於西，此天上日月也。 存思之图 《存思口诀》：青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武，四神也。 狮子，地兽，在我下者，乘我者也。 比地马同类之神者也。 白鹤飞禽，在我上者，覆我者也。 龙共类而仙者也。 四方上下之神备至，名曰六仪。 方见日月之形，洞焕室内，则水火二象见矣，五炁备矣，乃通前三炁也。 此灵宝始生天地之象也。 密咒章 玄师曰：有心咒，心中神存意祝也。 有微咒，自己可闻其声也。 有密咒，心言而已，口动无声也。 密咒曰： 所谓密者，口诵心觉，神意洞冥，外人不可晓其声也。 召仙曹总章咒 左手玉清文，右手上清文。 高天之上，玉清为主，玄罡大魁，太玄生府，中有帝君，灵虚王母。 法曰：凡灵宝洞玄仙官，皆属西元王母内禁灵虚宫。 玉文金符，司治仙禁，金童玉女，校精辩魔，统制伯史。 法日：伯史乃人身命门中一神名，此神专升降三宫，互传人身功过等事。 上达三天，形成司举，传奏教令，蠲灾救苦。 备卫护道，囚缚鬼侮，流浪诸天，济生度死，解厄摧怪，通达紫府，十天告命，召其所主，急急如上清灵宝命，元始上帝敕。 密诵一过，布十方炁，叩齿九通，次存玄元太上道君在虚空中，侍卫真灵俨然。 发炉咒 无上玄元太上道君，　太清文。 太清金阙后圣玄元上道君。 玄师曰：凡启奏太清，即告五灵玄老君，召出身神。 若关启上清，即告真元教主太上老君。 若启奏元始天尊，即告太上道君。 召出　臣某　身中三五功曹、　玉清文。 三天功曹、三天自然更生功曹、传言功曹、飞香功曹、奏事功曹、玄妙功曹、五帝功曹、五帝自然更生功曹、传言功曹、飞香功曹、奏事功曹、玄妙功曹。 玄师曰：三五功曹有二端神化，各司灵局，有三元五德之神，乃太清洞神之所隶也。 此三天五帝功曹，亦非胎化有形之类，皆三五自然真炁之所化也。 此天真道炁，召录身中三田五脏正炁而成灵神，用功曹有所执之曹局，故日功曹。 功曹弁冠之帻皂纨单，衣绛衣、佩剑执簿。 左右官使者、　卯文、酉文、玉清文。 阴阳通达之神，五官举意之先也。 使者弁冠之情，绛章单衣，皂衣色服，佩符执仗。 侍香金童、　玉清文。 阳初清洁之炁。 传言玉女、　玉清文。 阴本净谨之灵。 传言侍香，奏意达诚，皆四品之元真也。 金童玉女，玉貌琼颜，宝钗云髻，青服大袖，仙带裙履。 五帝直符、　玉清文。 东方青帝直符、南方赤帝直符、西方白帝直符、北方黑帝直符、中央黄帝直符，各三十二人。 亦是五方真炁符，合道德之炁所化也。 五帝直符，善恶二容，曲脚幞头，锦袍束衣，束带绿靴，悬剑执垛，各随方服色。 直日香官，　玉清文。 是直六十甲子之日三皇子孙也。
